title: Can anyone write a poem on childhood? - Quora

response.answer_text: Travelling down the lost path! Frivolous days they were,Laden with smidgens of smiles and big eyes,Expecting our stomachs to be filled always;Savored were the worldly chapters into our little minds;That path seems to be far away,Never to be taken again…. Feared were the browbeats,Trembling under the shadows of the desks;We were,charged with school fights,Still cherished were those times of gory.That path seems to be long lost,Never to be taken again…. Clout we were,by our idolsThe teachers known,only forHome works,classrooms and long scales,Still treasured are those scars on our knuckles;That path led us to a better future,Never to be taken again… Lionized we were,at our grandma’s,Stuff with summer cakes and late nightsEverything made a difference,unlike nowCounting on tomorrowsWhile that path was of nowNever to be taken ever again… Coz we have moved too forward to remember that pathThe path of innocent childhood….Is that path still open coz I’d run and never return… This poem is from my blogspace brundaoperan.wordpress.com

Secured I felt in my mother's womb, excited I felt to kick her womb , merry go round I played in her womb , dancing I owned in her womb, secured is what I felt in her womb.Outer world I felt is notorious, starred at the colors of world, slept better than every previous time, drank milk like that's the only taste for me, smile and my body movements were mine which made people go mad, yet secured I felt in her arms.Cried when I was departed from her to school, ABCD I started with, rhymes is what I danced upon, friends were my partners in life , teachers taught me the meaning of life, yet secured is what I felt on her laps.I grew as life went on , different things I learnt with experiences , realized that my childhood was on it's ending stage , love and hatrednes I experienced both together , yet secured is what I felt in her belief on me.MOM was and is the only constant person I believed in my life more than myself because secured is something I still feel with her presence in my life. Childhood is something that can never fit in this Small space to pen on but the ending of my poem can surely come across. Thank you everyone for reading.

The lost innocent and bright days How innocent and bright was my childhood days, Believing all the blunders my friends did say, Laughing loud with all my friends to their splendid wits, In the school that had a roof covered with hay. The blurred faces were so truthful and kind, Missing my classmate with whom I shared the bench, The teacher who always stopped me chew the pencil's end, And my poor friend who shared her leaf packed lunch. Chased the moon and fireflies at night, Played in the pastures and watched the mantis fight, Slept in the woods hearing dry leaves murmur with the breeze, And when our stomach growled we aimed the trees. These childhood memories often touch my mind, The only memories that haunts and lives in me, And now I watch my childhood travel with the wind Far on the other side of the never ending sea. Sreelal Sreedharan

I wrote one poem on childhood in hindi… ओ मेरे प्यारे बचपन तू फिर से लौट आ ले चल मुझे उस दुनिआ में ,जहा थी ना कोई फ़िक्र न कोई परवाह मुझे तू फिर उन पुरानी यादों से मिला वो पुराने दोस्त वो खेल खिलोने और अठखेलिया ना कमाने की फ़िक्र ना जीने के लिए थी भागदौड़ वहा काम था अपना सिर्फ पड़ना खेलना और मस्तिया वो पापा की डांट के डर से पलंग के निचे छुपना करना नाटक पड़ने का, और शैतानी में दिमाग का घूमना वो स्कूल बेल बजने का इंतजार ,और घर के लिए सरपट दौड़ना घर जाके माँ के हाथ का खाना खाना ,और उसी में जमाने भर का सुख सोचना वो चिड़ाना भाई बहनो को अच्छी अच्छी चीजे खाके,थोड़ा रोकना वो लड़ना खेल खिलोने के लिए और मिल के उन्हें आखिरी में तोडना वो होली और दिवाली पे नए कपडे आने का इंतजार और पहन के उन कपड़ो को दिखाना ठाट बाट वो स्कूल ना जाना बना के बहाना पेट दर्द का और बंक कर के टूशन दोस्तों के साथ घूमना ना था कोई गम ना मंजिल की परवाह ना कोई खवाहिश और दोस्रो से ईर्ष्या तब ना तो पैसे थे और ना कोई बड़े सपने अपने थे हम तो बस उन चंद दोस्तों और छोटी छोटी चीजों में खुशिया ढूंढा करते थे कहने को सब कुछ है मगर वो बचपन जैसा सुख कहा वो बेफिक्र ज़िन्दगी ना कल की चिंता ना आज की परवाह चाहे आज जितना सफल हो जाये उस बचपन को ना हम वापिस ला पाएंगे वो मस्ती हसी शैतानिया उनको कैसे भुलायेंगे ओ मेरे प्यारे बचपन तू फिर से लौट आ ले चल मुझे उस दुनिआ में जहा थी ना कोई फ़िक्र न कोई परवाह

This one. I wrote this a long time ago: An ode to May and all the summers May 12, 2012 at 4:00pm Have you ever wandered out in the May noon with the careless nonchalant feet Of an inquisitive child Have you ever followed the ants under the summer scented shades as they marched in perfect queues to seek their unknown destinations Have you ever felt the taste of stolen mango pickle on your sweaty palm long after the last yummy lick Have you ever felt the touch of sands under your feet cooled by the endless peepul breezes Have you ever felt childhood still Frolicking through your veins? Have you … (C): Sridevi Datta

Memories Chocolates, icecreams, candies, and Fries; Life was having no worries that time. Enjoying rasna after tiring day at school, Was still better than drinking beer to look cool. Watching pogo-disney made us happy, GOT was never in our fantasy. Hide n seek was just a game of play, untill we grew up to find people this way. Thought school bags were heavy, Now there is much more burden we carry. Visit to nani house was mandatory every year, Now the memories flow as tears. Now the memories flow as tears. Thanks :)

Hello, I have plenty of poems on childhood. Here is a link to some of my poems Poems of childhood Martine is a bilingual teacher of special of special children; Corcel and Isis are both autistic 8 year olds; and Eliana possibly is autistic. The intent of these focused poems is to illustrate aspects of the childhoods of atypical children and to sensitize parents/caretakers to their strengths. Meanwhile, check out this poem written for little Azana:

Maa ki kadhai mein, mehak raha hai dekho bachpan....Bhaiya se ladai mein, chehak raha hai dekho bachpan... Didi ki badhai mein, muskura raha hai dekho bachpan....Dadi ki dawai mein, chatpata raha hai dekho bachpan.... Nani ki mithai mein, gunguna raha hai dekho bachpan.....Papa ki khichayi mein, bunbuna raha hai dekho bachpan..... Cycle ki safai mein, daud raha hai dekho bachpan....Homework ki burai mein, beet raha hai dekho bachpan..... Dekho...kahin beet na jaye bachpan, Kyunki laut kar bachpan ke zamane nahi aate.... ~Nishtha Sethi

I have written a poem on childhood in Hindi. I have written many poems .One can read them in http://storymirror.com.By writing My name Harsukh Raivadera. Now read my poem. * बचपन मेरा प्यारा है * बचपन मेरा बहोत प्यारा हे, सुंदर सा बहोत न्यारा है ! पापा और मम्मी की आंखों का तारा हुँ दादी और नानी का दुलारा हुँ ! चॉकलेट खाने क्यों देते नही ? कोल्ड ड्रिंक पीने क्यो देते नही ? दूध पिलाने के लिए सब पीछे दौड़ते हे, खाना खिलाने के लिए हाथ जोड़ते है ! मुजे सुलाने के बाद सब सोते हे, नाराज होने प्यार से मुझे मनाते है ! ऐसा बचपन मेरा बहोत प्यारा है सुंदर सा बहोत न्यारा है ! Harsukh Raivadera “HASU”

I once opened a book endless possibility and so much time to imagine thousands of worlds from here to there but that couldn’t last it soon became no “don’t do this” nope no do not it became not a can I not a should I but a will I someday oneday and that’s all I have now

Life-stages I was once a child Like A seed of plant. Fresh and strong, Pure and white Like Love I have in heart. Old-man-I-am-now Like a dry hay Under the sun, Like A flame in the sky. Few time to wiat Or More to wiat For the soul to raise, And For the body to rest. Michel Ivossan
Can anybody do better than these? I think not. https://www.gutenberg.org/files/1934/1934-h/1934-h.htm
